question: Question_06_(a)
statement:
Use the linear approximation to $f(x) = \sqrt[3]{x} = x^{1/3}$ at
$a = 8$ to approximate $\sqrt[3]{7}.$
sols:
Using the formula for linear approximation to a function f(x) near x = a
= 8, we have

\begin{align*}
L(x) &= f(a) + f'(a)(x - a) \\
&= \sqrt[3]{8} + \frac{1}{3(8)^{2/3}}(x - 8)\\
&= 2 + \frac{1}{12}(x - 8)\end{align*} Since 7 is somewhat close to 8, we can estimate
$\sqrt[3]{7}$ by evaluating L(7). Thus,

\begin{align*}L(7) = 2 - \frac{1}{12} = \frac{23}{12} \quad \Rightarrow \quad {\color{blue}\sqrt[3]{7} \approx\frac{23}{12}.}\end{align*}
